author: potuz
content:
Hello, I want to get in-depth acquainted with the theory behind data-availability and the sharding branch of the repo. But I am facing a little problem which is lack of language. Many of the introductory posts are written towards devs or coders and are very basic in their mathematical content but filled with jargon that I assume is basic for the CS oriented person.  As an example, the post by Vitalik:
https://vitalik.ca/general/2017/01/14/exploring_ecp.html
Sketches on very basic algebraic geometry, but has sentences like `And going up to quadratic is enough to let us work with deterministic threshold signatures` that require me to look everywhere to understand.  I would **highly** appreciate some help finding some technical documents for me to start reading. I already read in some detail `Kate, Zaverucha and Goldbert`,  but besides that and Vitalik's post above, I only read the documents linked in the repo, that is Dankrad's https://dankradfeist.de/ethereum/2020/06/16/kate-polynomial-commitments.html and https://hackmd.io/G-Iy5jqyT7CXWEz8Ssos8g 
What would you indicate to someone that knows nothing of cryptography besides the basics of RSA and ECC?
